column2: Post-Doctoral Fellow in Computational Biology
column3:
Johns Hopkins University
Department of Biomedical Engineering
[ JEFworks Lab](https://jef.works/team)
Supervisor - Dr. Jean Fan
column7: Development of <u>open-source computational pipelines and statistical software</u> to characterize and <u>visualize</u> cell type <u>spatial organizational patterns</u> in tissues.
column8: Directly analyzed and extracted meaningful cell type spatial relationships from leading-edge technologies such as <u>Visium, MERSCOPE, Slide-Seq, DBiT-Seq</u>.
column9: Annotated cell types and quantified their spatial co-localization changes across <u>immune tissues using CODEX highly multiplexed spatial protein expression data</u>.
column10: Applied <u>convolutional neural networks to segment cells in H&E images</u> to increase the resolution of Visium datasets.
column11: Developed statistical software packages in <u>`R` and `Python`</u>. Performed extensive high-throughput analyses with a <u>high-performance `Linux` cluster</u>.
column12: **Characterizing spatial gene expression heterogeneity in spatially resolved single-cell transcriptomic data with nonuniform cellular densities** | [* Genome Res 2021*](https://doi.org/10.1101/gr.271288.120)
column13: **Reference-free cell type deconvolution of multi-cellular pixel-resolution spatially resolved transcriptomics data** | [* Nat Commun 2022*](https://doi.org/10.1038/s41467-022-30033-z)

column2: Ph.D., Molecular Biology
column3:
Johns Hopkins University
National Institutes of Health Graduate Partnership Program
Advisor - Dr. Laura Elnitski
column7: Dissertation: [ Investigating Blood-based Biomarkers and Patterns of DNA Methylation in Tumors](https://jscholarship.library.jhu.edu/handle/1774.2/62531)
column8: Optimized <u>single molecule detection assay</u> to quantify rare fragments of <u>methylated cell-free DNA in patient plasma</u>. Developed <u>computational machine learning algorithms</u> leveraging heterogeneous methylation patterns to optimize <u>liquid biopsy cancer diagnostics</u>.
column9: Developed pipeline to process cell-free DNA from hundreds of patient plasma samples. Samples were analyzed using <u>ddPCR and qPCR</u>.
column10: Bisulfite sequencing analysis of extracted cell-free DNA to <u>detect rare methylated DNA variants</u>.
column11: Assessing ZNF154 methylation in patient plasma as a multicancer marker in liquid biopsies from colon, liver, ovarian and pancreatic cancer patients | [* Sci Reports 2021*](https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-020-80345-7)
column12: Leveraging locus-specific epigenetic heterogeneity to improve the performance of blood-based DNA methylation biomarkers | [* Clin Epigenetics 2020*](https://doi.org/10.1186/s13148-020-00939-w)
column13: The emergence of pan-cancer CIMP and its elusive interpretation | [* Biomolecules 2016 *](https://doi.org/10.3390/biom6040045)
